summary: The Boeing 707 was the first jet airliner made by Boeing. It flew for the first time in 1957 and was used by airlines starting in 1958. The 707 has four engines and a wide body, allowing six seats across in economy class. It was very popular in the 1960s and 1970s for long flights. Boeing made many different versions, some with longer range or more powerful engines. Over 850 were made, not including the similar Boeing 720. The 707 helped start the "Jet Age" in air travel.
title: Boeing 707
